text: Richard Orraca-Tetteh (5 March 1932 - 23 February 2002) was a Ghanaian biochemist and nutritionist. He was a pioneer for the study of Nutrition and Food Science as an academic discipline in Africa. For several years, he taught at the University of Ghana, Legon ==Early life== Orraca-Tetteh was born in Accra on the 5th of March,1932. He was educated at Accra Academy from 1948 to 1952. He took a Bachelor's degree at the University of Ghana, Legon in 1959. In 1960, he entered the University of London and earned a Ph.D degree in Nutrition. ==Career== Orraca-Tetteh worked briefly as a Nutrition Officer at the Ministry of Health in Accra. After his postgraduate training, he transferred to the University of Ghana, Legon where he spent his professional life in teaching and research. In 1973 Oracca-Tetteh was a visiting professor at the University of California, Berkeley. From 1990 to 1992 he was a visiting professor at the University of Maryland, College Park. He was a consultant to the Food and Agriculture Organization and also to the United Nations University (UNU) and was the first coordinator for UNU-affiliated institutions in Africa. He was made a member of the British Nutrition Society and the Ghana Institute of Nutrition and Food Technology. He was a member of the International Union of Nutritional Sciences, and he represented the African Region for 12 consecutive years on the Executive Council, a position he relinquished only in August 2001. ==Honours== The Larway Orraca-Tetteh (LOT) Block at the School of Nursing, University of Ghana, Legon is named in joint honour of him and another. ==Publications== * ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2002 deaths Category:Alumni of the Accra Academy Category:Ghanaian academics Category:Alumni of Achimota School Category:University of Ghana faculty Category:Alumni of the University of London Category:20th-century Ghanaian educators
